meanings.definition: Relating to or situated in a transept.
meanings.sent1: The transeptal window allowed light to fill the side of the church.
meanings.sent2: The transeptal arch connected the main nave to the side wing of the building.
meanings.sent3: The transeptal design of the room made it feel like a hidden alcove.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as transeptal as the grand entrance of the cathedral.
meanings.sent5: The artist captured the tranquility of the garden with a transeptal painting.

meanings.definition: Crossing or passing through a transept.
meanings.sent1: The transeptal pathway led directly to the courtyard.
meanings.sent2: The transeptal corridor provided a shortcut to the other side of the building.
meanings.sent3: The transeptal route through the park was a scenic detour.
meanings.sent4: His voice echoed through the transeptal hall, reaching every corner.
meanings.sent5: The train tracks ran transeptally through the heart of the city.
